entry.title: SuccessFactors Mobile App - Timesheet to network codes/work orders functionality workaround
entry.content:
Hello everyone.

We currently using the time tracking functionality on the SuccessFactors mobile application, however due to the limitations of the app, our employees cannot assign their time to a specific network code/work order.

Have any other SuccessFactors customers faced the same issue and if so, how have you worked around it so that your employees can accurately and easily apply their time to the correct costing project.

Thank you!

entry.title: Homepage - how to change Custom Cards layout
entry.content:
Hi all,

I've added two custom cards to a custom folder within Organisational Updates. The cards are working fine and displaying correctly but they are displaying 'vertically' i.e. one is showing underneath the other.

I want them to display across the page i.e. horizontally (in same way as the layout of the Quick Action cards at the top of the homepage) - can I do this and if so, how do I do it? See image below for how they are currently displaying, red arrow shows where I want the custom card to appear. Please note, it's not the order of the cards I'm questioning, it's the layout i.e. horizontal instead of vertical.

Any help is much appreciated!

Thanks.

entry.title: Workzone - is it possible to merge content from different channels?
entry.content:
Hello,

I don't think this is possible but maybe I missed something on the documentation. Say you have a workzone instance (standard) with multiple channels configured (e.g. S/4 HANA and business solutions), and they contribute pages with the same names. Is it possible to merge them instead of having a duplication of tabs with the same name ?

 

Thanks in advance

 

@Vera_Gutbrod @ThomasReiss

entry.title: My inbox view does not work after upgrade
entry.content:
Hi Guru's

We just upgraded to 2023 FSP02 and we are experiencing an issue with the view on the 'My inbox' app. The view does not work anymore and I am not able to change the existing views. According to other notes (3163682 - Filter on Fiori My Inbox - SAP for Me) I should be able to 'switch' to Expert mode' but I do not see such a switch. According to my authorisation team the expert mode shoud be enabled. 

We have some custom field that should be shown and ran the reports RSWD_MAINTAIN_USER_ATTR and  RSWW_FILL_USER_ATTR but to no avail. 

Where should I start looking?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Issue with User Visibility in People Picker on Manage Flexible Workflow Application
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently in the process of configuring a workflow within the Manage Flexible Workflow application. However, we are encountering an issue where no users are visible in the People Picker field. Despite ensuring that all required prerequisites as per the KBA mentioned below have been met, we are still unable to see any users listed.

0002824240 - No users available in People picker of Manage workflow application

0002869055 - No users available in Manage Workflows app - SAP S/4HANA

We have followed the standard setup guidelines and checked the user assignments, but the problem persists. Could anyone from the community suggest what could be causing this issue or any troubleshooting steps we might have missed?

It can retrieved data from entity set 'ZCDS_ZTALCUSTOMER'

Another sap-all user can retrieve data from entity set 'BANK'.. 

 

So I doubt there is any authorization  is forgotten. Do you have any idea?

entry.title: User Type FW is Not Active in SAP?
entry.content:
User Type FW is Not Active Error 

When we try to create a reference user or copy an existing user using SU01 t-code in SAP then we face the error message: User Type FW is not active in SAP. 

This error comes when the user you are copying is of type FW (Workflow System User), and in your system, this user type is not yet activated or supported because the workflow configuration is incomplete. 

In my case, we faced this issue specifically with user type FW but in your case the user type may be different. So it‚Äôs important to first identify your user type. 

How to Check and Activate Missing User Types using USMM T-Code.

  1. First Run the T-code USMM in the SAP GUI. 
  2. Then Click on the User Types tab. 

 

       3. Select and activate the missing user type FW or any other that's required. 

       4. Save your changes. 

Now try to create or copy the reference user again. If the error persists feel free to reach out or comment below if I can help resolve your issue I definitely will!

entry.title: Beyond Fiori: Elevating UX in SAP Systems to Drive Real Business Value
entry.content:
In the world of ERP, and particularly within SAP environments, UX is often discussed in terms of visual appeal and Fiori tiles. However, the true strategic value of UX goes far beyond aesthetics. It is about transforming the way users interact with complex systems, reducing friction, and unlocking measurable business impact. This post explores advanced aspects of UX in SAP, the challenges organizations face, and actionable strategies that drive real results.

UX is not just about making interfaces look good. It begins with a deep understanding of the end-to-end processes and the human context in which the system operates. Every process step carries potential for error, inefficiency, or delay. Designing for role-specific needs rather than for screens ensures that every user, from HR managers to warehouse operators, experiences an optimized workflow. Good UX directly improves KPIs by reducing errors, shortening task completion times, and increasing adoption rates across the organization.

Integrating UX with analytics creates a powerful feedback loop. Real usage data uncovers which screens waste time, where users encounter obstacles, and which processes are bypassed or executed inefficiently. Insights from these analytics allow organizations to redesign flows rather than simply polish screens, because ERP UX is fundamentally flow-driven, not pixel-driven.

Automation and intelligent design take UX to the next level. Simplifying forms, minimizing unnecessary fields, and providing context-aware recommendations reduces cognitive load and errors. Inline validations and immediate feedback improve accuracy and boost confidence in the system. These patterns turn SAP from a rigid tool into a proactive assistant for the user.

Drawing inspiration from B2B and B2C UX standards can further elevate ERP systems. Consistency across desktop, mobile, and tablet platforms ensures users experience the same intuitive interactions regardless of device. Micro-interactions and subtle feedback cues improve comprehension and engagement. Adaptive interfaces tailored to roles, departments, or geographic context make the system feel personalized without requiring extensive customization.

Finally, UX success in SAP is as much about culture as it is about design. Executive support is critical to challenge entrenched workflows and encourage adoption of improved practices. Collaboration between IT and business units ensures that UX improvements are meaningful and strategic rather than cosmetic. Investment in user training, combined with iterative design informed by real-world data, creates a sustainable UX-driven culture that delivers measurable business outcomes.

Elevating UX in SAP is not a one-time project; it is a continuous journey that blends design thinking, process insight, analytics, and cultural alignment. When executed thoughtfully, it transforms SAP from a functional system into a strategic enabler, enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and overall business performance.

entry.title: Why do many power users still prefer SAP GUI over Fiori in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
SAP learner here üëã

As I dig deeper into S/4HANA UX, I keep running into a pattern: even in organizations with a well-set-up Fiori Launchpad, a lot of experienced users still default to SAP GUI. I‚Äôm not trying to start a GUI vs. Fiori war‚Äîgenuinely curious about the practical reasons behind this and what has worked to shift habits

I am looking answers for the following topics: 

  • A concrete task where GUI wins (e.g., ‚ÄúDisplay/Change X,‚Äù ‚ÄúHigh-volume posting,‚Äù ‚ÄúMass edits‚Äù).

  • Why Fiori fell short (speed? feature gap? layout? navigation?)

  • Workarounds or fixes you‚Äôve tried

  • If you‚Äôve successfully moved teams to Fiori, what made the real difference? 

  • Which roles experience the biggest benefits with a switch from GUI to FIORI? Which Roles generally prefer to stay in GUI?

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during Upload of Pages
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i have the following issue when trying to upload pages in a new starter customizing tenant.
What i wanted to do, was export custom pages from a different tenant which is part of internal system environment and import them in a new starter customizing tenant for workshops.
The system tells me that the pages cant be uploaded and this is the error message:

I think the issue is, that the system i downloaded the pages from, has german as its original language and the starter customizing system usually have english as the original language. 

My question is, can i do anything to solve this ? I tried changing some language keys from "DE" to "EN" in the json file that is imported, but this only results in the same error but with the translation "English(EN)" instead of "German(DE)" (compare screenshot).
Where can i even check what the original language of the tenant is ?

Best regards 
Lukas
